title: Textile, 1920s
medium:
Medium: rayon
Technique: screen printed on plain weave
dimensions: Warp x Weft: 267 x 87 cm (8 ft. 9 1/8 in. x 34 1/4 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William Goulding
description: Highly graphic, stylized design of Diana the Huntress accompanied by running dogs, shooting backward at an antelope, with other prancing horned animals. A framework of curving vines unifies the design. Printed in black on a white ground.
justification: This particular textile was designed by Thomas Lamb (1896-1988) and manufactured by the DuPont Rayon Company in the 1920s. The motif is screen printed in black on white rayon, plain weave ground. The design itself shows a highly graphic, lyrical, stylized Diana the Huntress accompanied by running dogs, who is shooting backward at an antelope surrounded by prancing horned animals while a framework of curving vines unifies the design.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1920s.
1920s. Medium: rayon
Technique: screen printed on plain weave. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William Goulding. 2003-7-2.
